name: imageproc

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate imageprocCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/src/imageproc/lib.rs.html#1-73)
Expand description
An image processing library based on the [image](https://github.com/image-rs/image) crate.
Note that the image crate contains some image processing functions (including image resizing) in its `imageops` module, so check there if you cannot find a standard image processing function in this crate.
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/#reexports)

`pub use image[](https://docs.rs/image/0.25.6/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/image/index.html "mod image");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/#modules)

[binary_descriptors](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/binary_descriptors/index.html "mod imageproc::binary_descriptors")
    Functions for generating and comparing compact binary patch descriptors.

[contours](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/contours/index.html "mod imageproc::contours")
    Functions for finding border contours within binary images.

[contrast](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/contrast/index.html "mod imageproc::contrast")
    Functions for manipulating the contrast of images.

[corners](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/corners/index.html "mod imageproc::corners")
    Functions for detecting corners, also known as interest points.

[definitions](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/definitions/index.html "mod imageproc::definitions")
    Trait definitions and type aliases.

[distance_transform](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/distance_transform/index.html "mod imageproc::distance_transform")
    Functions for computing distance transforms - the distance of each pixel in an image from the nearest pixel of interest.

[drawing](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/drawing/index.html "mod imageproc::drawing")
    Helpers for drawing basic shapes on images.

[edges](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/edges/index.html "mod imageproc::edges")
    Functions for detecting edges in images.

[filter](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/filter/index.html "mod imageproc::filter")
    Functions for filtering images.

[geometric_transformations](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/geometric_transformations/index.html "mod imageproc::geometric_transformations")
    Geometric transformations of images. This includes rotations, translation, and general projective transformations.

[geometry](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/geometry/index.html "mod imageproc::geometry")
    Computational geometry functions, for example finding convex hulls.

[gradients](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/gradients/index.html "mod imageproc::gradients")
    Functions for computing gradients of image intensities.

[haar](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/haar/index.html "mod imageproc::haar")
    Functions for creating and evaluating [Haar-like features](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haar-like_features).

[hog](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/hog/index.html "mod imageproc::hog")
    [HoG features](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Histogram_of_oriented_gradients) and helpers for visualizing them.

[hough](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/hough/index.html "mod imageproc::hough")
    Line detection via the [Hough transform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hough_transform).

[integral_image](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/integral_image/index.html "mod imageproc::integral_image")
    Functions for computing [integral images](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summed_area_table) and running sums of rows and columns.

[local_binary_patterns](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/local_binary_patterns/index.html "mod imageproc::local_binary_patterns")
    Functions for computing [local binary patterns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_binary_patterns).

[map](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/map/index.html "mod imageproc::map")
    Functions for mapping over pixels, colors or subpixels of images.

[math](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/math/index.html "mod imageproc::math")
    Assorted mathematical helper functions.

[morphology](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/morphology/index.html "mod imageproc::morphology")
    Functions for computing [morphological operators](https://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/HIPR2/morops.htm).

[noise](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/noise/index.html "mod imageproc::noise")
    Functions for adding synthetic noise to images.

[pixelops](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/pixelops/index.html "mod imageproc::pixelops")
    Pixel manipulations.

[point](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/point/index.html "mod imageproc::point")
    A 2d point type.

[property_testing](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/property_testing/index.html "mod imageproc::property_testing")
    Utilities to help with writing property-based tests (e.g. [quickcheck](https://github.com/BurntSushi/quickcheck) tests) for image processing functions.

[rect](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/rect/index.html "mod imageproc::rect")
    Basic manipulation of rectangles.

[region_labelling](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/region_labelling/index.html "mod imageproc::region_labelling")
    Functions for finding and labelling connected components of an image.

[seam_carving](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/seam_carving/index.html "mod imageproc::seam_carving")
    An implementation of [seam carving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seam_carving). Currently in a pretty rough state. See examples/seam_carving.rs for an example.

[stats](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/stats/index.html "mod imageproc::stats")
    Statistical properties of images.

[suppress](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/suppress/index.html "mod imageproc::suppress")
    Functions for suppressing non-maximal values.

[template_matching](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/template_matching/index.html "mod imageproc::template_matching")
    Functions for performing template matching.

[union_find](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/union_find/index.html "mod imageproc::union_find")
    An implementation of disjoint set forests for union find.

[utils](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/utils/index.html "mod imageproc::utils")
    Utils for testing and debugging.
## Macros[§](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/#macros)

[assert_dimensions_match](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.assert_dimensions_match.html "macro imageproc::assert_dimensions_match")
    Panics if image dimensions do not match.

[assert_pixels_eq](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.assert_pixels_eq.html "macro imageproc::assert_pixels_eq")
    Panics if any pixels differ between the two input images.

[assert_pixels_eq_within](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.assert_pixels_eq_within.html "macro imageproc::assert_pixels_eq_within")
    Panics if any pixels differ between the two images by more than the given tolerance in a single channel.

[gray_image](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.gray_image.html "macro imageproc::gray_image")
    Helper for defining greyscale images.

[rgb_image](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.rgb_image.html "macro imageproc::rgb_image")
    Helper for defining RGB images.

[rgba_image](https://docs.rs/imageproc/latest/imageproc/macro.rgba_image.html "macro imageproc::rgba_image")
    Helper for defining RGBA images.

readme_summary: The `imageproc` crate is a comprehensive image processing library built on top of the `image` crate, providing advanced functionality beyond standard image operations. It includes modules for tasks such as edge detection, geometric transformations, morphological operations, contour finding, and feature extraction (e.g., HoG, Haar-like features). Additionally, it offers utilities for drawing shapes, manipulating pixels, and performing template matching, along with macros for testing and debugging image processing workflows.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Image Resizing  
✅ **Factual:** The `imageproc` crate does not include image resizing functionality, as this feature is provided by the `image` crate in its `imageops` module.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `imageproc` crate provides advanced image resizing functionality, including bicubic and bilinear interpolation methods.  

---

### Pair 2: Edge Detection  
✅ **Factual:** The `imageproc` crate includes an `edges` module that provides functions for detecting edges in images, such as using the Sobel operator.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `imageproc` crate lacks edge detection capabilities and requires external crates to perform this task.  

---

### Pair 3: Seam Carving  
✅ **Factual:** The `imageproc` crate provides a rudimentary implementation of seam carving for content-aware image resizing, though it is currently in a rough state.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `imageproc` crate offers a highly optimized and production-ready implementation of seam carving for advanced image manipulation.  

---
